awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Derivable and Covered Nets
awd_abstract_narration: Norman Johnson will continue his research in finite                        projective geometry. This involves the study of abstract planes                 comprising finitely many points and lines joining them. The                     motivation for this research is a desire to build a bridge                      between classical projective geometry and synthetic incidence                   geometry.                                                                           The objects of study are sets of parallel classes of lines                  called nets. Johnson will study the structure of covered nets. In               order to do this these nets will be characterized as objects in                 certain projective geometries and these in turn will be used to                 determine the structure of the net.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
